name: Integrated Supercapacitors
desc: This ship has an extensive array of fast-charging supercapacitors, cooling systems, and high-density conduits built into its weapon hardpoints. All energy weapons mounted to this ship deal %s increased damage and generate %s more flux.
short: Energy weapon damage and flux cost is doubled.

name: Fourth Battlegroup
desc: Built to the specifications of the elite 4th Domain Battlegroup, this vessel is a prime example of the Domain Navy's 'invincible wall' doctrine, particularly exhibited by a series of exotic shield modifications performed using pre-Collapse industrial technology. This increases the ship's shield arc by %s and unfolding rate by %s, and reduces its upkeep by %s.  Oversized flux sinks additionally reduce shield damage taken by %s. Significant internal changes provide a %s bonus to OP budgets, but reduce hull and armor by %s.
short: Increased shield arc and unfolding speed, decreased shield damage taken, upkeep cost, armor strength, and hull.

name: Harmonic Energy Projector
desc: This ship's integrated harmonic energy projector increases energy weapon range and projectile velocity as its flux level increases. The projector utilizes hard flux to catalyze the acceleration, and as such, cannot function without any hard flux buildup. The bonus scales with the current flux, up to a maximum of %s increased range and %s increased projectile velocity at %s flux.
short: Increased energy weapon range and projectile velocity as flux increases.

name: Automated Fighter Bays
desc: This ship is equipped with a rudimentary strikecraft automation suite, substituting human pilots with sub-gamma AI and %s Unfortunately, the system is %s

name: Inefficient Ammo Feeders
desc: While the Tigershark is unique among most ships of its era for its ability to fit ballistic weapons, its targeting core was not designed to accommodate them, reducing ballistic weapon base range by %s.

name: PD Specialization
desc:
This ship is optimized for usage in a point-defense role, and receives a flat %s unit increase to the range of all PD weapons. This system allows the use of additional targeting augmentations, but locks maximum weapon range to %s units.

Incompatible with Safety Overrides.
short: PD range increased, other weapons are more expensive.

name: Compact Missile Autoforge
desc: Repurposed fighter nanoforges built into the ship's weapon hardpoints allow in-combat restocking of missile weapons. Missile weapons gain ammo regeneration equal to %s of their maximum ammo per minute.

name: Covert Ops Refit
desc: A hideously expensive refit for ships intended to operate clandestinely in hostile space. Improved sensor packages increase sensor strength by %s, while an advanced stealth coating reduces sensor profile by %s. Upgraded engines increase top speed by %s, zero-flux speed bonus by %s, and allow it to apply at up to %s flux. These modifications collectively increase maintenance by %s.

name: Drive Field Compressor
desc: A variant of the Drive Field Stabilizer, the Drive Field Compressor improves fleet-wide engine performance by increasing the density of overlapping drive fields. This increases the fleet's acceleration by %s, and reduces the fleet's detected-at range by %s. This stealth bonus does not apply when using Sustained Burn or Emergency Burn. More than one Drive Field Compressor has no effect.
short: Increases fleetwide engine performance and reduces sensor profile.

name: Advanced Energy Interface
desc: Reduces the OP cost to fit large energy weapons by %s.
short: Reduces OP cost of large energy weapons.

name: Advanced Weapons Interface
desc: Reduces the OP cost to fit large energy weapons by %s, and large ballistic and missile weapons by %s.
short: Reduces OP cost of large energy and missile weapons.

name: Adaptive Subsystems
desc: This ship can switch to one of three modes, significantly enhancing its engines, weapons, or defenses. Effects require %s to reach full strength after changing modes.
short: Can swap modes to improve weapons, engines, or defenses.
